docs.text:
The ReSpeaker Project




Note


The website is still under construction




The ReSpeaker project provides hardware components and software libraries to build voice enabled device.




Hardware


The hardware components include I2S 2 microphone array, I2S 4 microphone array, USB 6+1 microphone array, ReSpeaker Core 7688.










USB 6+1 Mic Array


4 Mic Array for Pi


2 Mic Array for Pi

on-baord ATmega32U4  for Arduino compatible usage,  touch sensor

Sofware


Audio processing algorithms including VAD, DOA, Beamforming, NS, AEC and KWS are available and are evolving rapidly.

docs.title: Sofware

docs.text:
USB 6+1 Mic Array




The USB 6+1 Mic Array is a circular microphone array with a 12 RGB LEDs ring. It has builtin VAD, DOA, NS and Beamforming algorithms.


Resources




respeaker python library
 for audio recording and LED control


Algorithms for raw data mic array

docs.text:
ReSpeaker 4 Mic Array for Raspberry Pi




The ReSpeaker 4 Mic Array for Raspberry Pi is a Pi hat with a 12 RGB LEDs ring. 


Resources




Driver

docs.text:
ReSpeaker 2 Mic Array for Raspberry Pi




The ReSpeaker 2 Mic Array is a Pi hat for Raspberry Pi. It has 2 microphones, stereo audio output, on-board class-d audio amplifier and 3 RGB LEDs.


Resources




Driver


Applications

docs.text:
ReSpeaker Core 7688




The ReSpeaker Core 7688 has 1 microphones, stereo audio output, on-board class-d audio amplifier, on-board ATmega32U4, 12 RGB LEDs and 8 touch sensors.


Resources




respeaker python library
 for audio recording and LED control


respeaker arduino library
